page.title: 12Employment
page.content: 7 of the 20 chilren in school live on farms and their fathers are employed in agriculture.2 are indirectly employed in agriculture,one as an agricultural machinery salesman and the other as an agricultural adviser. 5 of the fathers are involved in the building trade, one as a salesman for plastic goods, one as an engineering salesman who travels over most of the western world, and both parents of three of the children are the local General Practitioners. Employment is very difficult to obtain by children leaving school.Many tend to leave the area.Some have been unemployed for a time.A few young men are self employed and work in the timber industry
